intro: Icacorea pectinata, commonly known as the silky wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features delicate, feathery leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Icacorea pectinata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native habitats.
